question: A global company with a large number of AWS accounts is seeking a way in which they can centrally manage billing and security policies across all accounts. Which AWS Service will assist them in meeting these goals?

explanation.whyCorrect: AWS Organizations is the correct answer because it best addresses the requirements stated in the question.
explanation.whyOthersWrong: "AWS Trusted Advisor" is incorrect because service that provides real-time guidance to help provision resources following aws best practices., which does not match the requirements. "IAM User Groups" is incorrect because collection of iam users that makes it easier to manage permissions for multiple users., which does not match the requirements. "AWS Config" is incorrect because it does not address the question requirements or is not the appropriate solution for this scenario.
explanation.additionalPoints: This question tests your understanding of AWS services, concepts, and best practices. Key concepts to review include: AWS service use cases, architectural patterns, cost optimization strategies, and security best practices. Make sure to understand the differences between similar services and when to use each one.
explanation.bestPractices: AWS best practices to remember: (1) Always design for failure and implement high availability across multiple Availability Zones or Regions, (2) Implement the principle of least privilege for security, (3) Use managed services when possible to reduce operational overhead, (4) Monitor costs and set up billing alerts, and (5) Follow the AWS Well-Architected Framework principles.

question: Which of the following is NOT correct regarding Amazon EC2 On-demand instances?

question: Jessica is managing an e-commerce web application in AWS. The application is hosted on six EC2 instances. One day, three of the instances crashed; but none of her customers were affected. What has Jessica done correctly in this scenario?
options: She has properly built an elastic system
She has properly built a fault tolerant system
She has properly built an encrypted system
She has properly built a scalable system
correctAnswer: She has properly built a fault tolerant system

explanation.whyCorrect: She has properly built a fault tolerant system is the correct answer because it best addresses the requirements stated in the question.
explanation.whyOthersWrong: "She has properly built an elastic system" is incorrect because it does not address the question requirements or is not the appropriate solution for this scenario. "She has properly built an encrypted system" is incorrect because it does not address the question requirements or is not the appropriate solution for this scenario. "She has properly built a scalable system" is incorrect because it does not address the question requirements or is not the appropriate solution for this scenario.
explanation.additionalPoints: This question tests your understanding of AWS services, concepts, and best practices. Key concepts to review include: AWS service use cases, architectural patterns, cost optimization strategies, and security best practices. Make sure to understand the differences between similar services and when to use each one.
explanation.bestPractices: AWS best practices to remember: (1) Always design for failure and implement high availability across multiple Availability Zones or Regions, (2) Implement the principle of least privilege for security, (3) Use managed services when possible to reduce operational overhead, (4) Monitor costs and set up billing alerts, and (5) Follow the AWS Well-Architected Framework principles.
